item.title: Meet Vim Sessions
item.author: info@makingdevs.com
item.description: A few weeks ago, while I was tracking and debugging a system in which I’m currently working, the client told me that another part of the system was having troubles. Suddenly, I’m on verge of close all the Vim’s buffer I’ve just opened because I need to switch branches meaning that I need a way to know in which files I was working before closing them. Needless to say, it was hard to found those files and I even haven’t made a change in them (I have just found them) Additionally, is a huge project with a lot of micro projects so, at this point, I didn’t know in which project I was working (I know my mistake).
